objects.name: Note
objects.string:
Use the arrow keys or left mouse button or touch to move the blue tank
If the green tanks see you they start chasing you and stop if you are out of visual range

events.comment: Move the blue tank with the arrow keys
If left mouse button or touch is down, move and rotate the blue tank toward the position of the pointer

Send a raycast from each tank toward the player.
The player and the wall object is both member of a group called solid and we use this group to set the player and wall to be obstacles for the raycast

events.comment:
If the raycast hit the player, set the Alert value of the tank to 1
Note this solution works only because we have only a single player in the scene.
Otherwise we should be using the variables IntersectionX and IntersectionY in order to check which instance was hit by the raycast
If a green tank is alerted, create a red circle, link it to the tank and make it follow the tank
Make Alert sprite disappear if the tank is no longer alerted, also make sure the link bewteen the IA and Alert is dropped as we no longer need it

Move alerted tank toward player using the pathfinding behavior
Tanks have the pathfinidng behavior and the walls having the pathfinding obstacle behavior so the tanks going to avoid the walls
Once a tank start moving even if the tank is no longer alerted it is still going to move toward the last set (known) position until they reach the destination and then stop
We add a random number to the destination of the tanks to avoid the tanks stopping in the same position and overlaping each other. The result, some tanks may move much longer then others even if they are not alerted
